text: To determine if there exists an integer \( x \) such that \( x^3 = 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \) for some integer \( n \), we start by analyzing the expression \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \).
class-1-reason: The paragraph introduces the problem and sets the context for the solution by laying down the equation to analyze systematically.
class-2-reason: Analyzing the initial expression is setting up the mathematical context.

class-1-reason: The paragraph establishes a plan to solve the problem using modular arithmetic, which is a structured approach to analyze all possible residues.
class-2-reason: Suggesting evaluating the expression modulo 9 indicates a plan for further exploration.

text: We will evaluate \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \mod 9 \) for \( n = 0, 1, 2, \ldots, 8 \) since these residues cover all possible cases for \( n \mod 9 \).
class-1-reason: The paragraph establishes a plan to solve the problem using modular arithmetic, which is a structured approach to analyze all possible residues.
class-2-reason: Explaining the procedure for evaluating the expression across all residues.

text:
\[
\begin{align*}
n \equiv 0 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 1 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(1) + 3(1) + 7 \equiv 13 \equiv 4 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 2 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(4) + 3(2) + 7 \equiv 25 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 3 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(9) + 3(3) + 7 \equiv 43 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 4 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(16) + 3(4) + 7 \equiv 67 \equiv 4 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 5 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(25) + 3(5) + 7 \equiv 97 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 6 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(36) + 3(6) + 7 \equiv 133 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 7 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(49) + 3(7) + 7 \equiv 175 \equiv 4 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 8 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(64) + 3(8) + 7 \equiv 223 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}.
class-1-reason: The paragraph performs specific calculations by evaluating the expression for different values of n modulo 9, following the structured approach outlined previously.
class-2-reason: Carrying out calculations for each case to determine equivalent expressions modulo 9.

class-1-reason: The paragraph performs specific calculations by evaluating the expression for different values of n modulo 9, following the structured approach outlined previously.
The paragraph summarizes the results obtained from the calculations and states the possible equivalence modulo 9, reaffirming previous findings.

text: Next, we consider the possible values of \( x^3 \mod 9 \).
class-1-reason: The paragraph sets up the next phase of problem-solving by determining the possible values of x cubed modulo 9, continuing the systematic approach.
class-2-reason: Indicating a shift of focus to evaluating x^3 modulo 9.

class-1-reason: The paragraph sets up the next phase of problem-solving by determining the possible values of x cubed modulo 9, continuing the systematic approach.
class-2-reason: Outlining the method for computing x^3 modulo 9 across residues.

text:
\[
\begin{align*}
x \equiv 0 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 0 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 1 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 1 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 2 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 8 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 3 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 27 \equiv 0 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 4 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 64 \equiv 1 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 5 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 125 \equiv 8 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 6 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 216 \equiv 0 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 7 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 343 \equiv 1 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 8 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 512 \equiv 8 \pmod{9}.
class-1-reason: The paragraph involves computations for each x to determine x^3 mod 9, following a systematic calculation path without exploring or verifying.
class-2-reason: Executing computation for each case using the stated method.

class-1-reason: The paragraph involves computations for each x to determine x^3 mod 9, following a systematic calculation path without exploring or verifying.

text: The possible values of \( x^3 \mod 9 \) are \( 0, 1, 8 \).
class-1-reason: This paragraph summarizes the results of the calculations from the previous paragraph without further exploration or verification.
class-2-reason: The sentence states the possible values of x^3 modulo 9 without performing calculations, setting up a mathematical understanding.

text: Since \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 4 \) or \( 7 \pmod{9} \) and \( x^3 \equiv 0, 1, 8 \pmod{9} \), there is no overlap between the possible values of \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \mod 9 \) and \( x^3 \mod 9 \).
class-1-reason: The paragraph draws a conclusion from previous calculations, indicating there is no overlap, a straightforward statement that consolidates results without checking.
class-2-reason: The sentence deduces and compares the possible values of two expressions to conclude no overlap.

text: Therefore, there does not exist an integer \( x \) such that \( x^3 = 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \) for any integer \( n \).
class-1-reason: This paragraph presents the conclusion based on derivations, methodically stating the result derived from previously discussed logic.
class-2-reason: The sentence concludes based on prior analysis that there is no integer solution.
